intro: Colymbada scabiosa var. pseudospinulosa, commonly known as the spiked honesty, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features slender, hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its common name refers to the spiky appearance of its flower clusters, which resemble tiny spikes.
